text: is it possible to use a Hubl Filter in a javascript statement
As long as you use the JavaScript in the html section of a module or anyplace where hubl is valid yes <@U2LEJ045D>
You would need to write the whole variable out in hubl though. You can mix hubl and js though.

Padding of empty divs is an implementation spec of the Rich Text editors using TinyMce. You may have better results inserting the form as an `embed` instead of straight into source code (I’m assuming that’s the method you’re using).
It's not a HubSpot form, unfortunately. :disappointed:
